physical_appearance:\This is a pamphlet entitled \\The Clerks Emplyment Ordinance\\. The colony of Singapore\u0027s coat of arms is printed on the pamphlet at the top left hand corner. There is a call number pasted on the bottom left of the book
subject_terms_1:as well as an identification code on the top left. However clerical workers colonial settlements rules (instructional materials) employment (general economic concept)
subject_terms_2:both have been struckthrough with a blue marker. A stamp from the Social Welfare Department\u0027s Library can be seen at the bottom right of the pamphlet. There are no visible tears on the pamphlets Clerks Colonies
subject_terms_3:but there is a dog ear at the top left corner of the book. A black and white outline of a man in formal business attire
subject_terms_4:who is sitting down and looking at folders on a table with a rotary dial telephone
context_1:is depicted at the centre of the phamplet\
context_2:guidelines
context_3:Informational pamphlets
context_4:Singapore. Ministry of Social and Family Development
